alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 11:49AM CDT until March 27 at 10:31PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Douglas, Ozark and Taney. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1148 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rainfall are possible through the afternoon, leading to continued flooding. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Beaver Creek at Old Cheese Plant Road, Bear Creek at Reno Springs Road, Little North Fork River at County Road 916, Bryant Creek at Highway 95, North Fork River at County Road 278, Spring Creek at County Road 142 and South Spring Creek at County Road 408. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Forsyth, Merriam Woods, Rockaway Beach, Taneyville, Kissee Mills, Bull Creek, Wasola, Thornfield, Squires, Rome, Noble, Brownbranch, Bradleyville, Rockbridge, Brixey, Gentryville, Powersite, Ozark Beach, Edgewater Beach, Dora, Walnut Shade, Lake Taneycomo, Bryant Creek State Park and Shepherd of the Hills State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
